name: 4h-thieno[2,3-b]thiopyran-2-sulfonamide, 5,6-dih
Reason: 1,2-thiadiazole ring introduces additional rigid structures that can participate in dipole interactions and potentially hydrogen bonding, raising the melting point by about +70°C. The sulfonamide group introduces a polar carbonyl-like functionalities, which can participate in dipole interactions and increase the melting point by approximately +30°C. The presence of two additional phenyl groups can also contribute to the melting point, estimated at approximately +20°C per group, totaling +40°C.
